alert.note: Alert for Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 10:25AM CST until February 11 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in west central Arkansas, Franklin and Sebastian. In Oklahoma, Latimer, Le Flore, Pushmataha and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1025 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Smith... Poteau... Charleston... Greenwood... Barling... Pocola... Heavener... Lavaca... Spiro... Arkoma... Panama... Talihina... Wister... Hackett... Howe... Altus... Hartford... Huntington... Bonanza... Bokoshe... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
